intro: Philibertia biloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in late spring. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Philibertia biloba is a perennial species that is relatively low-maintenance and can be grown in gardens with well-drained soil.
